message: hell yes, audiobooks in the gym in my newest discovery. perhaps im a year or two too late to the party
anyone else foregoes music for audiobooks while working out?

I generally don't listen to music - I find the cord/phone thing distracting. I have started bringing along podcasts of Radiolab though - that's been awesome. They're also about the right length for me.
I can't have anything hanging or attached either. How do you listen to podcast?
@dmoylan I generally grit my teeth and deal with it. When I can I run the headphone cord under my shirt. After a while it doesn't bother me. Can't do it for lifting though, just running.
Podcasts are my preferred distraction. I particularly like APM's "Marketplace", because it's almost exactly enough time for a 30 minute couch-to-5k run on the treadmill.
Anybody use a bluetooth unit to listen to audio while running and/or working out?  I also hate hanging wires.
I didn't know you could use bluetooth for just listening! Don't have one, but it sounds much better than earbud wires dangling.
